a fun if not buggy and sometimes irritating game  i have always been a huge fan of both syndicate and syndicate wars and satellite reign is a worthy spiritual successor the gameplay is often repetitive and the story which is actually pretty good is told in a very non linear fashion which can certainly lead to gaps by the time the credits roll  this game is a lot of fun despite some of its short comings buy on a sale and play with friendsif you have any

this is an excellent game in which firepower and blasting your way through isnt always the best solution  sometimes stealthily sneaking into an area and getting what you want is the best solution  the hacker and the rogue are your most valuable assets if used right   the variety of weapons gear and augmentations plus the variety of attributes for your clones keep the game interesting to the end  and the final conclusion is worth working towards  overall this is an awesome game

excellent game especially for fans of syndicate back in the day great for anyone looking for squad tactics and map exploration the missions are extremely easy to jump in and out of and theres a nice balance of lethality with feeling like your agents can do something  the bounds between explorable and secure zones could feel a little more distinct but other than that its a really nice game

there is an area in the grid where you have the three major corps in close proximity to each other  all three corps dislike each other and will fight if provoked  toss a grenade within hearing distance of two opposing patrols and watch the chaos unfold as they call for more and more backup eventually leading to a three way war in the street

this game is a sequel to the mega drive syndicate which was the best game i personally thought the consul offered the next title in the series was syndicate wars which managed to the better  i guess that the intellectual property belonged to someone else hence its an unofficial sequel its the best in the series usually sequels suck but im really happy with how this game was directed

a very good game it has its own atmosphere of syndicate syndicate wars but it is also a hybrid with commandos it has improved interesting mechanics a very welldeveloped research and production tree great weapons and utility items agents have a developed tree of implants and by gaining experience we develop their individual skills lets pray for a new version of the game by the same author

graphics wise this game is great gameplay leaves a lot to be desired i think i would have enjoyed it more had combat been turnbased instead of realtime given that its hard to run away from enemies and how they gang up on your operatives it feels unfairly difficult

i redownloaded this to properly try it out despite having all of the fixings of a turnbased game its a realtime strategy with no pause it also has an awkward control scheme given that im slow and i panic easily i decided the game was suboptimal

got a copy of this for free from a friend i cant say i would recommend it tutorial bugged out resulting in a hard reset as a unit got caught in a wall and was considered trespassing preventing teleport game world is massive way larger than suitable for an rts style i get they were trying for an rts of shadowrun here but controls are clunky and leave a lot of downtime with very little guidance on where to go or anything i love shadow run and cyberpunk but this isnt it

great wee game nice open world incarnation of the likes of syndicate wars or commandos type games except a bit more forgiving but a lot more puzzles in the environment more or less just dumped into the world to achieve the objectives in any way you see fit nice soundtrack too able to be played in coop too though not tried that too much

satellite reign looks nice has a nice cyberpunk setting leaves a lot of room for player improvisation which increases the replay value because in each area there are several ways to achieve your goals overall its a halfbaked gem that i quite enjoyed playing despite a number of bugs and glitches
the best syndicatelike game so far still unique in spite of its age

its not too often that a game comes around which offers multiplayer isometric coop in an open world the setting is wonderfully atmospheric and its a lot of fun to romp around pulling realtime heists with your friends no complaints  that said this is not a deep game  the loop is simple execute heist upgrade equipment pull another one rinse repeat  for my money 100 recommendation even at full price
